meanings.definition: Harmful or detrimental to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The storm's prejudicialness caused damage to the crops.
meanings.sent2: The medicine's prejudicialness to the patient's health was unexpected.
meanings.sent3: The cat's prejudicialness towards the new puppy was evident in her hissing.
meanings.sent4: The prejudicialness of procrastination can lead to missed opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The prejudicialness of gossip can harm relationships.

meanings.definition: Showing bias or unfairness towards a particular group or individual.
meanings.sent1: The judge's prejudicialness towards the defendant affected the trial.
meanings.sent2: Her prejudicialness towards people from different cultures was evident in her comments.
meanings.sent3: The clown's prejudicialness towards red noses was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The prejudicialness of the media can influence public opinion.
meanings.sent5: His prejudicialness towards certain sports teams was well-known among his friends.
